page.title: 17The Lighthouses: Function.
page.content: In{1920}the original equipment in the High Light was replaced by a vapourised petroleum system.It was electrified in{1950.}There was a Chief Keeper at High Light.He had an Assistant Keeper at North Low,but this has been demolished for many years.The lighthouses formed a triangle.The High Light, the leading light, is at the apex.This works with South Low to guide ships through the deep water channels between South Killingholme and the Lower Humber and Goole.The leading light can be seen from{14} miles away.Before{1950,}visibility was only{11}miles. The lighthouses are now run by Associated British Ports.Previously they were controlled by Humber Conservancy Board,until{ {1908,}then British Transport Docks Board until{1965.
